intro: Ptisana rigida, commonly known as the rigid ptisana, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Ptisana rigida features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in spring. It is often found in fynbos vegetation, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat.
